Question Text: Which of the following properties are characteristics of virtual networks (but not necessarily characteristics of SDN). Select all that apply.
Choices:
a. Separates the data and control plane.
b. Refactors network control so that network behavior is controlled from a single logically centralized controller.
c. Separates logical and physical networks.
d. Often deployed in data center networks to allow multiple tenants to share physical network infrastructure.
e. Abstracts the details of the physical network.
LLM Explanation: Virtual networks have the following key characteristics:  c) They separate the logical network topology from the underlying physical network infrastructure. Multiple virtual networks can be overlaid on the same physical network.  d) They are commonly used in multi-tenant data center environments to allow different tenants (customers) to share the same physical network hardware while keeping their traffic logically isolated.   e) Virtual networks abstract away the details and complexity of the physical network from the perspective of the virtual network users/tenants.  While virtual networks and SDN are related concepts that are often used together, characteristics (a) separating data and control planes and (b) logically centralized control are more specific to SDN rather than virtual networks in general.

Question Text: Which of the following are possible ways of creating virtual links in a virtual network? Select all that apply.
Choices:
a. A wide-area tunnel, whereby an IP packet is encapsulated in an MPLS tunnel by attaching an MPLS header to the packet.
b. Longest-prefix match forwarding on an IP router.
c. A wide-area tunnel, whereby an Ethernet packet sent between two virtual machines is encapsulated in an IP packet.
d. VLAN switching based on a VLAN tag.
e. Pairs of virtual Ethernet interfaces, where one end of the Ethernet interface pair resides in the virtual environment, and the other resides in the root namespace on the host machine.
LLM Explanation: Virtual links in a virtual network can be created through various methods. Wide-area tunnels using MPLS (a) or IP encapsulation of Ethernet packets (c) enable virtual links across a network. VLAN switching based on tags (d) allows creating isolated virtual links on the same physical infrastructure. Virtual Ethernet interface pairs (e) can connect virtual environments to the host. Longest-prefix match forwarding (b) is a regular IP routing mechanism and not specific to creating virtual links.

Question Text: Which of the following are true of the Mininet network emulator? Select all that apply.
Choices:
a. It requires running OpenFlow-capable switches.
b. It is difficult to use it to route traffic for real services.
c. Mininet only allows users to create three types of topologies: linear, tree, and single-switch topologies.
d. It can create an emulation that runs across multiple physically distributed nodes.
e. All of the hosts in the topology must run the same underlying operating system.
LLM Explanation: Choices b and e are true statements about Mininet:b) Mininet is primarily designed for emulating networks for testing and development purposes. It can be challenging to use it to route real network traffic and services.e) In a Mininet emulation, all the emulated hosts share the same kernel and underlying operating system as the machine Mininet is running on. The hosts are essentially processes in network namespaces.Choice a is false - Mininet uses software-based OpenFlow switches by default and does not require physical OpenFlow switches.Choice c is false - While Mininet provides some built-in topology classes like linear, tree and single, it allows creating custom topologies of arbitrary complexity.Choice d is false - A Mininet emulation runs on a single machine. Distributed emulation would require additional tools.

Question Text: What are the benefits of emulation as opposed to, say, simulation? Select all that apply.
Choices:
a. An emulation will complete faster than a simulation.
b. An emulator makes it possible to "port" experiments from one machine to another.
c. An emulator allows the experimenter run real software on each of the nodes in the emulation.
d. An emulation is easier to debug than a simulation.
e. Every run of the emulator will yield exactly the same results, resulting in reproducible experiments.
LLM Explanation: The benefits of emulation over simulation are:b) An emulator makes it possible to 'port' experiments from one machine to another. Emulators provide a standardized environment that can be easily moved between different physical machines.  c) An emulator allows the experimenter to run real software on each of the nodes in the emulation. Emulators provide a realistic environment where actual software can be executed, as opposed to simulations which model software behavior.The other options are not correct:a) Emulations are not necessarily faster than simulations. The speed depends on many factors.d) Emulations are not inherently easier to debug than simulations. Debugging depends on the tools available.  e) Emulator runs are not guaranteed to yield exactly the same results each time, as they depend on real-time factors and can have some variability.

Question Text: Which of the following are possible in Mininet? Select all that apply.
Choices:
a. Measuring the latency between a host in San Francisco and a host in Los Angeles.
b. Assigning custom IP addresses to each node in the topology.
c. Assigning IP addresses to each node in the topology using a DHCP server.
d. Running performance measurement tools (e.g., iperf, wget) between nodes.
e. "Shaping" a link between two nodes to a particular traffic rate.
LLM Explanation: In Mininet, it is possible to assign custom IP addresses to each node in the topology (b), run performance measurement tools like iperf and wget between nodes (d), and shape the traffic rate on a link between two nodes (e). However, Mininet is an emulation environment running on a single machine, so it cannot measure actual latency between geographically distant hosts (a). Also, while IP addresses can be assigned, Mininet does not include a DHCP server functionality to automatically assign them (c).

Question Text: Which of the following functions does FlowVisor enable? Select all that apply.
Choices:
a. Allowing two different researchers to implement and deploy different load balancing applications for all traffic between the same source-destination pair.
b. Allowing two controllers to control traffic on distinct VLANs.
c. Allowing two different researchers to implement and deploy different Web load balancing applications for port 80 traffic.
d. Allowing two different researchers to implement and deploy control mechanisms for two distinct applications.
e. Allowing one controller to control TCP traffic and one controller to control UDP traffic.
LLM Explanation: FlowVisor enables network virtualization by allowing multiple controllers to simultaneously control overlapping sets of physical switches. It can slice the network based on various parameters like VLAN tags (b), application types (d), or transport protocols like TCP/UDP (e). However, it cannot slice the network based on source-destination pairs (a) or specific port numbers (c) to allow different applications on the same traffic.

Question Text: Which of the following are stated applications of the Nicira Network Virtualization Platform? Select all that apply.
Choices:
a. Easier transition to IPv6 in data-center networks.
b. Creating more than 1024 virtual networks, as opposed to the alternative of using VLAN tags.
c. Allowing experimental protocols to coincide with a production network.
d. Central management of security policies.
e. Dynamic workload placement in multi-tenant data centers.
LLM Explanation: The Nicira Network Virtualization Platform enables several applications in data center networks:b) It allows creating more than the 4096 virtual networks possible with VLAN tags by using network virtualization. This enables large-scale multi-tenancy.c) Network virtualization allows running experimental protocols on the same physical infrastructure as production traffic by isolating them into separate virtual networks. d) The central controller of the NVP enables defining and managing security policies across the entire data center network from a single point.e) By decoupling virtual networks from the physical infrastructure, NVP allows dynamically placing and migrating workloads anywhere in a multi-tenant data center.However, easier IPv6 transition (choice a) is not a stated benefit of NVP in the course material.
URLs: ['Nicira Network Virtualization Platform (NVP) Overview. Coursera - Software Defined Networking course by Nick Feamster.', 'The Road to SDN. ACM Queue Magazine, December 2013, by Thomas A. Limoncelli.']

Question Text: Select the statement that is most true about the relationship between network virtualization and SDNs.
Choices:
a. Network virtualization is a potential enabler for software-defined networks, since the separation of data and control planes first requires the creation of a logical network.
b. Software-defined networking is a potential enabler for virtual networks, since separation of data and control planes makes it easier to manage a logical network topology.
c. Network virtualization is a new concept introduced by Amazon, Nicira, and industry players; it only made sense to talk about network virtualization once central SDN controllers existed.
d. Network virtualization and software-defined networking each enable the other: SDN cannot exist without network virtualization, and network virtualization cannot exist without SDN.
LLM Explanation: Both statements a and b are true about the relationship between network virtualization and SDNs. Network virtualization enables the creation of logical networks separate from the underlying physical infrastructure, which is a prerequisite for separating the data and control planes in SDNs. At the same time, the separation of data and control planes in SDNs makes it easier to manage and orchestrate virtual network topologies. So network virtualization and SDN are complementary technologies that enable each other, but one is not strictly dependent on the other.
